document_title: Testicular atrophy: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Testicular atrophy is a phenomenon in which a man's testicles shrink. Each male will have two testicles and are shaped like eggs. The two testicles are surrounded by the scrotum.
The scrotum has the function of regulating the temperature around the testicles. If the temperature is cold, the scrotum will contract and expand when exposed to higher temperatures. This condition can occur due to trauma, varicocele, complications of post-mumps orchitis... (1)
